main event: On 25 May 1952, multiple witnesses observed unidentified flying objects in the sky over Walnut Lake, Michigan and Randolph Air Force Base, Texas.
interesting points: The objects appeared as teardrop-shaped lights with a white mass and an orange tinge, captained by an experienced navigator with considerable air traffic knowledge., Twelve objects were observed flying in a tight V-formation, seen in groups of four., The speed of the objects was estimated between 1500 to 2000 miles per hour., Witnesses were able to follow one object in a car for half a mile before it vanished into a cloud., Weather conditions allowed for clear visibility of the unidentified objects against a very dark sky.
witness description: Captain John S. Jones and two other individuals with flight experience.
